Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric contains many small metallic inclusions, the exterior, now cracked and flaked away in parts, is covered with a red-brown slip and faint traces of four lines of Greek text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393834) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393834)
